intro: Mollinedia selloi var. obovata, commonly known as the Obovate Mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
